AFFABLE.Definition: friendly and easy to get on with

AIRWAVES.Definition: used to describe television and radio

ANTAGONISE.Definition: to annoy someone by doing something they do not like

ANTI-SEMITISM.Definition: hostility or prejudice against jewish people

ARISTOCRAT.Definition: a person of the highest class in society

CHARISMA.Definition: the power to influence and attract others

CHARISMATIC.Definition: having charisma, a natural ability to attract others

DISRUPT.Definition: prevent something from happening as planned

ENVISIONED.Definition: imagined that something would happen in the future

EXONERATING.Definition: saying that someone is not responsible for something

FASCISM.Definition: a right-wing political system characterised by extreme control by the stage

FATE.Definition: what happens to someone, in particular at the end of their existence

HYPERINFLATION.Definition: a state where prices increases very quickly

LURKING.Definition: waiting quietly and secretly, often in a threatening way

MAGNETISM.Definition: a quality that makes someone attractive to others

ORATOR.Definition: someone who is good at public speaking

PAVING THE WAY.Definition: creating a set of circumstances that allow something to happen

POSHEST.Definition: the most expensive and high class

PUPPET.Definition: a person who allows others to control them

RADICAL.Definition: very different to the current situation

REBELLIOUS.Definition: opposing the ideas of others in authority

REPUTATION.Definition: if you have a reputation for something, you are known for it

RESONATED.Definition: if an idea resonates with you, you agree with it

SCAPEGOATING.Definition: blaming a group of people for something

SCAPEGOATS.Definition: to blame a group of people for something

SERVICEMEN.Definition: people who work in the armed services

SNAP.Definition: a snap election is an election that is called quickly

STRIKINGLY.Definition: in a way that people notice easily

SYMPATHISER.Definition: someone who supports a particular idea

THE USUAL SUSPECTS.Definition: the people or things that are normally involved in a particular activity

WELL SPOKEN.Definition: speaking in a refined and educated manner

WORKFORCE.Definition: the group of people who work in a society
